item.title: Auto LPG could be a game changer in reducing emissions with appropriate fiscal incentives: IAC Director
item.description: Noted for its clean-burning properties, Auto LPG significantly reduces emissions of particulate matter, nitrogen oxides, and carbon dioxide, thereby contributing to improved air quality and reducing the overall carbon footprint of the nation.

item.title: Revolutionising MSME automobile dealerships with affordable AI-Driven ERP Solutions
item.description: The MSME sector is a crucial part of the Indian economy but often lacks accessible technology solutions. Traditional ERP systems are usually expensive and have long implementation times, failing to address the specific needs of smaller verticals effectively. Readywire intends to close this gap by offering affordable AI-driven ERP solutions tailored for automobile dealerships, aiming to streamline their business processes and improve operational efficiency.

item.title: Fed up of traffic jams? By 2030, you may have air taxis in Hyderabad
item.description: Chennai-based The ePlane Company and Bengaluru-based Leap Aeronautics are also part of the initiative to introduce eVTOLs for urban air mobility in India by 2030.

item.title: Car dealerships in North America revert to pens and paper after cyberattacks on software provider
item.description: On Monday, Group 1 Automotive Inc., a USD 4 billion automotive retailer, said it is using "alternative processes" to sell cars to its customers. Lithia Motors and AutoNation, two other dealership chains, also disclosed that they implemented workarounds to keep their operations going.

item.title: Force Motors partners with EY Parthenon India for digital transformation program
item.description: Force Motors has partnered with EY Parthenon India to undertake a digital transformation programme aimed at boosting innovation and productivity across its value chain. The collaboration will focus on redesigning Force Motors' digital landscape, implementing advanced digital platforms, technologies, and solutions for customers, and enhancing its capabilities and security.

item.title: CDK Global begins to restore systems after cyber hack
item.description: CDK Global is working to restore systems for 15,000 auto retailers after a cyber incident. Hackers demanded ransom to end the hack.

item.title: Indian and EU startups pitch for cooperation in EV technologies
item.description: The India-European Union Trade and Technology Council (TTC) Working Group 2 on Friday held a pivotal start-up matchmaking event aimed at advancing battery recycling technologies for electric vehicles (EVs). According to a press release, the event, which took place in New Delhi, featured twelve promising start-ups from both India and the EU, reflecting a shared commitment to innovation, sustainability, and stronger economic ties between the two regions.

item.title: Altair ups the ante in simulation, data analytics for automakers
item.description: The US-headquartered company is betting big on India’s auto industry for optimal use of its competencies in simulation and data analytics. The leadership team is confident that the sky’s the limit and business is poised for tremendous growth in the coming decade.

item.title: NHAI taking AI route for better road signs to improve safety
item.description: In order to enhance road safety, NHAI has signed an MoU with Indraprastha Institute of Information Technology (IIIT), Delhi, a technical university established by the Delhi government, to leverage Artificial Intelligence (AI) based solutions for improvement in the availability of road signs on national highways.

item.title: The Imperative Shift to Industry 4.0 for Indian Automakers: A New Era of Transformation
item.description: The Indian automotive industry has evolved significantly with the advent of Industry 4.0, impacting auto component manufacturers. The transition involves adopting advanced technologies like IIoT and machine-to-machine connectivity. Industry 4.0 enhances supply chain visibility and is crucial for global competitiveness.

item.title: M&M advances digital transformation with Dassault Systemes 3DEXPERIENCE Platform on the Cloud
item.description: Mahindra & Mahindra is advancing its digital transformation by selecting Dassault Systèmes’ 3DEXPERIENCE platform on the cloud to accelerate new product development.

item.title: ETAuto Tech Summit 2024: Software, sustainability, cybersecurity to define the future of auto industry
item.description: Henrik Fisker, CEO of Fisker Inc, addressed the global demand for electric vehicles at the ETAuto Tech Summit, emphasizing the irreversible shift towards EVs.

item.title: KR Fuels obtains approval for LPG conversion in 2Ws
item.description: KR Fuels secures approval to retrofit LPG into BS4 two-wheelers in India, offering eco-friendly solutions with precision-manufactured kits at Trichy facility.

item.title: Boult launches CruiseCam to enhance road safety and connectivity
item.description: The Boult CruiseCam X1 and X1 GPS are now offered at introductory prices of INR 2,999 and INR 3,999, respectively. These cameras can be purchased on Amazon, Flipkart, and on the company's official website, the company stated in its media release.

item.title: Deloitte unveils 'Fuels of the future' report at the 5th edition of ETAutoTech Summit 2024
item.description: Deloitte India launched a report on alternative fuel options at the ETAutoTech Summit 2024, highlighting India's shift towards sustainable energy. The report mentions the FAME III scheme funding for cleaner transport solutions.

item.title: China approves autonomous driving startup Momenta's US IPO
item.description: China in June granted approval to a first group of nine automakers to carry out tests on vehicles with advanced autonomous driving technologies on public roads, as part of a plan to accelerate adoption of self-driving cars.

item.title: ETAutoTech Summit 2024 kick-starts today, themed ‘Engineering Sustainable Transition’
item.description: ETAuto announces 5th Tech Summit on 'Engineering Sustainable Transition' in Bengaluru at Sheraton Grand Hotel. Indian and international technocrats and experts are assembling in this two-day mega event (June 20 and 21) to discuss and debate on the present cutting-edge technology trends, and also to peep into the automotive technology landscape of tomorrow.

item.title: Tata Technologies launches 2nd edition of InnoVent Hackathon with Microsoft and Tata Motors
item.description: Tata Technologies, in partnership with Microsoft and Tata Motors, launches the second edition of the InnoVent hackathon. The event focuses on developing Generative AI-enabled innovations for the manufacturing industry.

item.title: Stellantis recalling nearly 1.2 mn vehicles to fix software glitch that disables rear camera
item.description: The recall covers Jeep Compass, Grand Cherokee, Wagoneer and Grand Wagoneer SUVs from the 2022 and 2023 model years. Also included are Ram ProMaster vans from 2022 and 2023, as well as the Ram 3500 chassis cabs and Ram 1500 and 2500 pickups from 2022. Also covered are 2021 through 2023 Chrysler Pacifica minivans and Jeep Grand Cherokee L SUVs, and 2021 and 2022 Dodge Durango SUVs.

item.title: Volvo Trucks enters LNG truck segment in India, fuel technology ‘first step’ towards its 2040 carbon neutrality target
item.description: The European truck major, and partner to India’s Eicher Motors, finds the first Indian customer in logistics company Delhivery. Volvo Trucks looks to leverage India more in terms of localisation sourcing, and technology development.
